7a20d2d5-d664-4888-a1cd-981a8d4584c5.description: The course objective is to provide knowledge and skills about financial management concepts including budgeting, cost analysis, accounting and fiscal management in the Department of Defense. Topics include government and DoD resource management environments; management internal controls; personnel management; manpower management; the planning, programming, and budgeting system; cost and economic analysis; process improvement; accounting; finance; auditing; fiscal law; and fiscal management.
7a20d2d5-d664-4888-a1cd-981a8d4584c5.name: Enhanced Defense Financial Management Training Course (ASMC-0001 v.3)

issuer.summary: issued by American Society of Military Comptrollers

badge_template_activities.title: Methods of assessment include quizzes, examinations, and case studies with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
Methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, case studies, classroom exercises, discussion, lecture, and practical exercises.

defabe54-d673-442c-9449-4a1823a9deae.description: To provide knowledge and skills about financial management concepts including budgeting, cost analysis, accounting and finance in the federal government and in the Department of Defense. Topics include government and DoD resource management environments; management internal controls; personnel management; manpower management; the planning, programming, and budgeting system; cost and economic analysis; process improvement; and accounting, finance, auditing, and fiscal law.
defabe54-d673-442c-9449-4a1823a9deae.name: Enhanced Defense Financial Management Training Course (ASMC-0001 v.1)

issuer.summary: issued by American Society of Military Comptrollers

badge_template_activities.title: Methods of instruction include lecture, case studies, discussion, PowerPoint presentations, and proctored examinations.

8e4594b2-beac-45d1-a626-0840960988aa.description: The course objectives are to provide knowledge and skills about financial management concepts including budgeting, cost analysis, accounting, and finance in the Federal Government and in the Department of Defense (DoD); as opposed to service-specific, financial management policies, and procedures; and define and provide instruction in the competencies covered in the Certified Defense Financial Manager (CDFM) examinations.
8e4594b2-beac-45d1-a626-0840960988aa.name: Enhanced Defense Financial Management Training Course (ASMC-0001 v.4)

issuer.summary: issued by American Society of Military Comptrollers

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, case studies, and examinations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual materials, case studies, classroom exercises, discussions, and lectures.

99e9cd1f-fe56-497d-a761-deb3a7052ce3.description: To provide knowledge and skills about financial management concepts including budgeting, cost analysis, accounting and finance in the federal government and in the Department of Defense.
99e9cd1f-fe56-497d-a761-deb3a7052ce3.name: Enhanced Defense Financial Management Training Course (ASMC-0002 v.1)

issuer.summary: issued by American Society of Military Comptrollers

badge_template_activities.title: Methods of instruction include lecture, case studies, discussion, PowerPoint presentations, proctored examinations, and a graded research project related to course material must be submitted within 90 days after completion of course instruction.  It must follow generally accepted graduate level standards in terms of content, references, and format.

12e376ee-6940-4676-b401-0b152e6fe826.description: To provide knowledge and analytical skills about financial management concepts including budgeting, cost analysis, accounting and finance in the federal government and in the Department of Defense.
12e376ee-6940-4676-b401-0b152e6fe826.name: Enhanced Defense Financial Management Training Course (ASMC-0002 v.2)

issuer.summary: issued by American Society of Military Comptrollers

badge_template_activities.title: Methods of instruction include lecture and PP presentations, case studies, discussion, proctored examinations, and a graded research paper related to course material that must be submitted within one year after course completion. It must follow generally accepted graduate level standards in terms of content, references, and format.

6956055f-7e91-4a15-bfb3-88e06be58b15.description: The course objective is to provide knowledge and skills about financial management concepts including budgeting, cost analysis, accounting and fiscal management in the Department of Defense. Topics include government and DoD resource management environments; management internal controls; personnel management; manpower management; the planning, programming, and budgeting system; cost and economic analysis; process improvement; accounting; finance; auditing; fiscal law; and fiscal management.
6956055f-7e91-4a15-bfb3-88e06be58b15.name: Enhanced Defense Financial Management Training Course (ASMC-0002 v.3)

issuer.summary: issued by American Society of Military Comptrollers

Methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, case studies, classroom exercises, discussion, lecture, and practical exercises.
